injuries.shortComment: Giddey was placed in the league's health and safety protocols Tuesday,  Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN reports.
injuries.longComment: The rookie is the latest player to enter protocols, joining teammates Tre Mann, Jeremiah Robinson-Earl, Aleksej Pokusevski and Darius Bazley. Given the NBA's updated quarantine policy, Giddey could miss as few as six days, so the hope is that he can return to the team early next week.

injuries.shortComment: Robinson-Earl was placed in the league's health and safety protocols Monday, Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN reports.
injuries.longComment: Robinson-Earl was one of three players for the Thunder who landed in the league's COVID-19 protocols Monday. It's not yet clear whether he's tested positive for the virus or when he'll be able to return, but Derrick Favors, Mike Muscala and Isaiah Roby should see increased playing time in his absence.
